name: "Trading Spaces"-The Ultimate Reality Show Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the designers bought a dishwasher for the homeowners' new kitchen?
questions.explanation:
Frank.

	This family had three kids, but no dishwasher! They had to wash everything by hand. Since Frank was working on their kitchen, he didn't buy a couple extra things, returned an extra box of floor tiles, and finally scraped together enough money to buy a dishwasher. By the way, I know people have been saying that it's HILDA Santo-Tomas, but I have a book about "Trading Spaces", and it spells her name HILDI. I've also seen it spelled that way in the program credits and on a couple websites, so that's what I'm sticking with. Hildi is her nickname, and I don't think it matters which one you use.

questions.text: Which of the carpenters has written a book about major and minor home repair projects?
questions.explanation:
Ty.

	Although Amy Wynn and Carter are carpenters on the show, Ty is the one who wrote the book, called "Ty's Tricks". Leslie Sergrette is one of the carpenters on "While You Were Out."

questions.text: As a very mean prank, one of the designers, on the second day, decided that he didn't like the colour of the newly painted room, and had the homeowners start painting it a different colour! Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Doug.

	In cahoots with Paige, Doug bought a new can of paint, and made the homeowners begin painting the wall a pastel green colour. However, he revealed the joke before they'd gotten very far on it.

questions.text: Who glued straw all over the walls of a family room?
questions.explanation:
Hildi & Hilda.

	The theme of the room was supposed to be a rustic one, and Hildi decided that instead of using wallpaper with pictures of straw on it, they'd use REAL straw.

questions.text: Which of the carpenters is left-handed?
questions.explanation:
Amy Wynn.

	I caught this once when Amy Wynn was sketching a picture of the armoir she was going to build for Doug's room, and noticed that she was using her left hand. Andrew is Andrew Dan-Jumbo from "While You Were Out".

questions.text: One of the female designers worked on a master bedroom. She painted the cathedral ceiling gold, one of the walls brown, and left the three remaining walls white. Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Genevieve.

	Unfortunately, the homeowners didn't like the room.

questions.text: Which of the designers lost his/her voice, and had to use signs to communicate on the second day?
questions.explanation:
Vern.

	Poor Vern! His voice was very gravelly on the first day, and on the second day, he had to write down what he wanted to say on a piece of paper. The room turned out great, though.

questions.text: Whose pants ripped when he went to the Home Depot to get some extra supplies?
questions.explanation:
Barry's.

	This was caught on the "Paige Cam". Paige looked down at Barry's pants, and exclaimed, "What happened?" "I had a little accident."  "Oh, my gosh. Cover yourself up, Barry!" Poor guy!

questions.text: Hildi once made an Venetian-style sconce by melting Gummy bears onto a piece of wax paper, and then letting them solidify.
questions.explanation:
False.

	This was actually a feature on "While You Were Out". Designer John Bruce had the idea.

questions.text: Genevieve always works in high heels.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Hildi is the one who works in high heels. Genevieve is notorious for taking her shoes off as soon as she gets into the room. Thanks for playing my quiz, and please rate it. If you have any questions or comments, I'd love to hear from you. :-)
